Class Auditorium

  • java.lang.Object
    • KeyedItem<java.lang.String>
      • Auditorium

  • public class Auditorium
extends KeyedItem<java.lang.String>
    The Auditorium class represents a room in a movie theater that plays movies.

    An Auditorium keeps track of the mvoies that it will show as well as the number of tickets sold for its movie.

    Since the Auditorium is identified by the name of the movie it is playing, the movie title can be obtained by a call to the getKey() method.

    The Auditorium's seats are arranged in a grid pattern with a given number of rows and seats per row.

    The structure of an Auditorium is immutable. Seats may not be added or removed after its initial construction. This is done so that the collection of occupied seats is not left in an inconsistentstate. Additionally, since each auditorium is identified by its movie title, the movie cannot be changed either. This keeps the movie from changing while there are seat occupants watching the current movie. If an Auditorium with a different movie or different seating structure is desired, a new Auditorium will have to be constructed.

        Parameters:
        movie - the movie being played by this Auditorium.
        rows - the number of rows of seats.
        seatsPerRow - the number of seats per row.

      • addParty

        public void addParty(java.lang.String partyName,
                     int partySize)
        Adds a viewing party to this Auditorium. The given party size must be less than or equal to the number of remaining seats. All party members will be listed under the given name.
        Parameters:
        partyName - the name of the viewing party.
        partySize - the number of seats to occupy.

      • removeParty

        public void removeParty(java.lang.String partyName,
                        int partySize)
        Removes a viewing party from this Auditorium. All viewers matching the given name will be removed. The given party size must be less than or equal to the total number of viewers currently in this Auditorium. Care should be given in providing an accurate party size. This method makes no attempt to find more party members than is specified in the argument. Once a number of viewers equal to the given party size has been removed, removal stops. If the number of party members removed is less than the given party size, a TheaterException will be thrown. Likewise, too few party members removed will result in some party members being left in the theater. An additional call to this method would fix such a problem.
        Parameters:
        partyName - the name of the viewers to remove.
        partySize - the numebr of viewers of the party to remove.

      • clearAllSeats

        public void clearAllSeats()
        Removes all film viewers leaving all seats empty.

      • generateSeatingChart

        public java.lang.String generateSeatingChart()
        Returns a formatted String representation of this Auditorium's seating. For each seat in the Auditorium, information about its location in relation to the rows is provided. Also, information about whether the seat is free or occupied is given. Occupied seats will have the occupant's name provided.
        Returns:
        the String representation of the seating chart.
